page.title: 15MEMORIES OF WOOKEY HOLE (1)
page.content:
THE RELATIVE PEACE OF WOOKEY HOLE TODAY IS QUITE DIFFERENT FROM WORLD WAR 11 EXPERIENCE.ENEMY AIRCRAFT OFTEN PASSED OVER THE AREA TO ATTACK CARDIFF AND BRISTOL; ONE MORNING, TWO BOMBS FELL ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF THE VILLAGE, AND ONE MAN DIED FROM SHRAPNEL WOUNDS. A RESIDENT IN HIS EIGHTIETH YEAR HAS MEMORIES OF BEING IN THE HOME GUARD. "IT WAS QUITE LIKE 'DAD'S ARMY'AT TIMES, HE RECALLED,'CHAOS REIGNING WHEN THE SAME SIGNAL, TWO BLASTS ON A WHISTLE, WAS USED FOR 'ATTACK' AND 'DEFEND' BY BOTH SIDES IN A MOCK BATTLE -THEY NEVER MET EACH OTHER!
HE REMEMBERED,ALSO,THE CORONATION OF KING GEORGE V WHEN CHILDREN FROM THE SCHOOL WERE EACH GIVEN A SOUVENIR MUG AND TIE PIN.
